variants.Description in input context: This substitution alters a highly conserved amino acid, potentially affecting protein function.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line expressing the LRRK2 mutant.

Readout description.Result Description: The c.1234A>G variant showed a significant increase in kinase activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent kinase assays were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each reaction was run in triplicate for technical reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control to ensure assay functionality.

Basic negative control.Description: A kinase-dead mutant of LRRK2 was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by a post-hoc Tukey test was used to compare kinase activity between conditions.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within the range observed for wild-type LRRK2

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding two standard deviations above the mean observed for wild-type LRRK2
